discourse_list.title: Did no one question the anomalies of Airdrop #2?

content.content: It is a surprise that Airdrop #2 is released so suddenly and airdropped directly to users, but it is also very intriguing!  The remaining airdrop amount of $OP is close to 600 million, and this time only 11 million will be distributed. If this standard is used, even if the airdrop is once a month, it will take 51 months to complete the distribution. This is not a good marketing plan; The Reward Type of this airdrop only has governance entrustment rewards and gas usage rewards. This does not reward real users who have been active in the OP network for a long time, including system users who have completed the tasks launched by OP. This is very unreasonable, or it is an official intention Let’s serve an appetizer first, and the main event that attracts the market’s attention will come later, or is the project party proud and complacent because of the current development achievements?

Welcome to express your thoughts and opinions, and also hope that the project can reward real users who have contributed to the development of the OP network. If users are used like donkeys, it will not benefit the long-term development of the project, and word of mouth will plummet.

This almost feels like a ponzi scheme. With this last airdrop you just reward the people that got in early and discourage to exit. I would suggest to mainly reward builders that attract actual users to the ecosystem. Most of the TVL still comes from greediness and pumping up bubbles instead of actual usage of blockchain technology. Find a way to distinct the real stuff from the gambling and you have a wonderful ecosystem.
I totally beg to differ the best technology on the Blockchain is here on optimism!!!

Are you aware of the OP rewards that go out to retroactive public goods funding for the most active participants and developers who are contributing to the ecosystem ??? I myself have been building on this network for the past 10 months and now I am in the nomination round for the 10 million OP that are available for rewards next month… I chose to be really heavily involved with the network on a level where it led me to a whole new opportunity that I never thought was ever possible in my whole entire life… This was after a long journey of struggling in the space during the early times from the beginning of 2021 until I discovered optimism from the Gitcoin ecosystem and my participation and involvement there… My earliest mentors in Blockchain education and solidity coding referred me to optimism in July 2021 where I originally submitted my information because I was passionate about the technology and appreciated the values and the ethos of this Network … The token rewards are going crazy with the other protocols that are here applying for proposals and there are a lot of tokens going out indirectly to people that are not being airdropped so please remind yourself of this when thinking about the overall picture of what optimism is trying to accomplish here in the space… The model is rewarding those for impact over reward… So take for instance I have helped to educate people and spread the word about the Network as well as guide others for their proposals here on the governance forums and become heavily involved and fascinated with the way that this system all works as I learn more… We are now putting all of our effort our energy and our soul into building a layer two NFT marketplace on optimism!!! We are going to create a dedicated Launchpad for creators and also an attestation station for the Fractal Visions platform. There are also other ways to use these NFT platforms like Quix in the past and their token reward system which we have the code for and is totally open source!!! Anybody can choose their destiny and build something amazing for other people to use on layer two!!! We are going to continue to iterate on this model along with our own public goods model for small artists and creators and developers who are part of our ecosystem!!! It has proven to be a very effective model and showing strong growth over the past 10 months!!!

Exactly, I agree with that thought. I think that’s the idea and in fact this airdrop was made precisely to support active users Because of the huge amount of hype lately on the topic of Airdrop from Layer-2 projects, it is now important to separate the true community from those who are just waiting for an airdrop

All speculation is futile, I just hope the official can understand that users are the cornerstone of development, once offended by the public and abandoned by the market, the consequences will be disastrous; it is wise to release Airdrop #3 as soon as possible!

I don’t understand why delegation is that important and everyone who voted actively in a snapshot vote without delegation of their voting power didn’t receive anything. Currently only governance participants who delegated their tokens to someone else or to your own received an allocation. EVERY active participant in governance should receive the same fair amount
i understand your sentiment however attracting users leads to adoption of what’s built on OP

In my opinion, airdrop 2 is a market test . OP team are looking for a better math results for airdrop 3. Airdrop 2 is designed only valued delegator and gas power user. After Op Quest, all activity data falls and far behind Arbitrum. It’s true that OP Quest attracts a lot of new users to try Optimism network. So OP team needs to find out, which part of users are true loyal to Optimism? I think most of the new users are attracted by clear tasks that you need to collect 10 NFTs for Quest. For Arbitrum, you can play games like beacon, you can trade in GMX. But Optimism ecosystem needs to grow. So for Airdrop 3 , OP team must award all Questers as soon as possible. And launch Quest season 2 at the same time. If no airdrop for OP Quest collector, there will be a huge disappoint for all participators. And all attentions will drawn to Arbitrum or Zksync.

Real users should be rewarded, the ones who actively/repeatedly use Optimism dapps. I disagree OP quest-collectors are real users, unless they repeatedly use the same dapps Governance voters are real users because they actively take part in the Token house/Optimism governance

I don’t want to disagree or start a fight, but just to let you know: I have also self-delegated my tokens, and did qualify for the airdrop. So while the 2000 OP threshold may have been too high for many, it’s incorrect to say those who self-delegated (i.e. didn’t delegate to someone else) and voted in Snapshots “didn’t get anything”.
That’s the point: ONLY if you (self)-delegated you received the allocation. If you voted in Snapshot governance proposals you didn’t qualify which doesn’t make any sense

Oh sorry, I didn’t know you could vote at all in Snapshot if you hadn’t delegated to yourself or someone else. I had thought that if there were no tokens delegated, to either yourself or another, then your voting power was zero (and thus you couldn’t vote, or at least your vote didn’t count). If the situation is something else, then I apologise for my misunderstanding.
